snippet: Debate over the health law has centered on the individual mandate, but the focus could shift to insurance exchanges.
abstract: Debate over the federal health care law has centered on the individual mandate, but the focus could shift to insurance exchanges once the Supreme Court decides whether the law is constitutional; exchanges are online marketplaces meant to simplify buying insurance; so far, only about 15 states have established exchanges, and many are balking.
lead_paragraph: Debate over the health law has centered on the individual mandate, but the focus could shift to insurance exchanges.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
